text: hi everyone and welcome back to the my
cupcake addiction kitchen where today
we're going to be combining two of my
favorite things ice cream and cupcakes
we're going to be making these fully
edible even the cupcake case layered
Neapolitan ice cream cupcakes they're
absolutely delicious
they look gorgeous and I can't wait to
show you how they made let's get started
to make your gorgeous ice cream cupcake
dessert I'm using some dream whip or
canned cream you can also use fresh
cream and I've got some really good
quality ice cream I'm using strawberry
from a Neapolitan effect with your ice
cream if you use a really cheap ice
cream it's actually going to lose volume
when you melt it down and then reset it
and it's going to reset really icy so
try and get the best possible strawberry
ice cream that you can afford for these
so that you regain that really nice
creamy texture when your cupcakes are
served I've got a pastry brush and a
sharp knife of course a cupcake tray and
I've lined that you'll need double the
amount of cupcake liners for the amount
of cupcakes that you want to make I've
got some sprinkles some glace cherries
and some melted pink chocolate and I'm
also going to use some melted dark
chocolate and some melted white
chocolate just so that I can make the
basis of my cupcakes a couple of
different colors I've got some ice cream
wafers and a couple of spoons and a
chocolate cake mix so any chocolate cake
mix you like you can even do a half
batch here because we're only going to
make really really tiny short little
chocolate cupcakes so essentially one
chocolate cake mix is enough to do 24 of
these ice cream cupcakes rather than the
usual 12 to start off with you want to
make up your chocolate cake mix I'm
totally cheating and using a packet cake
but like I said use your favorite recipe
but you make sure this is chocolate
because that's going to add to the
chocolate strawberry and vanilla look of
our finished cupcakes once that's all
mixed up you want to fill each of your
cupcake cases about 1/4 to 1/3 of the
way up so really don't go any more than
1/3 here once you've got your chocolate
cake mix in all 12 of your cupcake
liners you want to pop them in the oven
but just bear in mind these are going to
cook a lot faster than a full sized
cupcake so if your recipe says 12 to 14
minutes put them in for about 6 or 7 and
just keep on checking them to make your
edible cupcake cases now I'm going to do
four of these pink four of them white
and four of them brown so I'm just
spooning in about two teaspoons of that
melted pink chocolate or candy melt and
then I'm gonna use my pastry brush to
drag that chocolate up the side edges
all the way to the tops of those cupcake
line
these cupcake liners are not the
cheapest of the cheap so they are
relatively thick which gives you a
little bit more support you want to sit
them back into the cupcake tray because
that's actually going to help them to
hold their shape pop those ones off into
the fridge and we're going to do two
coats here so once your first lot has
completely set bring them back out of
the fridge and we want to repeat that
process two thin coats is a lot better
than one thick coat here and when you do
a second coat just do them one at a time
so spoon in the chocolate drag it up
spoon in the chocolate drag it up
because they'll be cold and your
chocolate is going to set a lot faster
than that first coat that you put in
once you've done all 12 of those they
can go back off into the fridge to
completely set and once they're set
which won't take long you can bring them
out and you just want to grab either a
really sharp knife or just your
fingernail underneath the edges so
you're just separating the edges of the
cupcake case I find its easiest to kind
of tear down and then just pull off the
cupcake case these held their shape
beautifully for me and I didn't break
any but if you're a little bit clumsy or
a little heavy-handed maybe allow for a
couple of casualties here all right so
your cupcake should be out and you want
to leave them on the bench to cool while
they're cooling also take your ice cream
out of the freezer so that it can start
to thaw out a little bit you want to
just pull out your little discs of
cupcake they're kind of cute and just
push them into the bottom of each of
your little cupcake cases this is
because it's not going to be an entirely
ice cream we kind of want cream ice
cream and cake all in the same little
chocolate case which makes it a whole
dessert now I'm just taking my slightly
thawed ice cream and it's not completely
melted it's instead it's still got some
little sort of chunks in there and I'm
scooping it into the cupcake cases that
chocolate is going to hold everything in
place make sure you smooth it out as
much as you can on top so they're nice
and neat and then pop them back into the
cupcake tray and back up into the
freezer to completely set they're
actually going to take probably another
two to three hours for that ice cream to
completely set again once it's
completely set and you'll see its really
really nice and firm we can get on to
decorating so I'm just using these
natural ice cream wafers you can also
use graham crackers or something along
those lines and I just cut them in half
and then in half again at an angle to
make some little triangle shapes I'm
going to use this canned dream whipped
cream just because I love the taste of
it but you can also use freshly whipped
cream or you can use a frosting here and
I'm just piping on like that little kind
of a cupcake you swirl on top on goes
some sprinkles and I know not everybody
loves glazed cherry so you can use some
sort of a red candy on top here but just
bear in mind that if you are going to
store these in the freezer red candy
will often lose its color when it comes
out to room temperature and the glace
cherries won't in goes one of your
little triangles and your ice cream
cupcakes are ready to serve I recommend
storing them in the freezer until just
before you're ready to serve them and
when they come out you cut into them you
can see you've got the chocolate case
the layer of cake that beautiful
strawberry ice cream cream on top and
